snippet: The group faces perhaps the biggest crisis in its short history, as it scrambles to distance itself from the Dallas gunman and tries to rebut a chorus of detractors....
abstract: Black Lives Matter activists are struggling to both distance group from Micah Johnson, African-American sniper who fatally shot five police officers in Dallas during rally against police violence, and respond to critics blaming movement for inspiring his deadly attack; backlash following mass shooting is biggest crisis group has faced so far in its short existence.

byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO and YAMICHE ALCINDOR

lead_paragraph: The group faces perhaps the biggest crisis in its short history, as it scrambles to distance itself from the Dallas gunman and tries to rebut a chorus of detractors.

headline.main: Black Lives Matter Was Gaining Ground. Then a Sniper Opened Fire.
headline.print_headline: Strides of Black Lives Matter Halt in an Instant

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dallas, Tex, Shooting of Police Officers (2016)
